page.title: 17TRADE: BARGES AT GRAVESEND
page.content: {Barges}are an important part of the river traffic at Gravesend. At {Crawley's Wharf}there are 6 barges. Two barges supply water to shipping for drinking and general domestic use and other barges deliver oil between depots and supply oil to ships. The {barges}operate on the{River Thames within port limits and on the{River {Medway}as far as Aylesford. The barges are based at Gravesend but can be moored as far apart as Woowich on the Thames, and Strood on the Medway. The men work 7 days a week. Their hours of work depends on the tides as the Thames at Gravesend is tidal.
